violationsByInspectionidList.violationDescription:
(A) PHYSICAL FACILITIES shall be cleaned as often as necessary to keep them clean.
(B) Except spill cleanup, cleaning shall be done during periods when the least amount of FOOD is exposed such as after closing.
NonFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES of EQUIPMENT shall be cleaned at a frequency necessary to preclude accumulation of soil residues.
violationsByInspectionidList.subLocation: On top of the Bulk food containers

violationsByInspectionidList.violationDescription: Light of the proper intensity shall be provided as specified.
Except as otherwise allowed, a direct connection may not exist between the SEWAGE system and a drain originating from EQUIPMENT in which FOOD, portable EQUIPMENT, or UTENSILS are placed. (P)
EQUIPMENT shall be maintained in a state of repair and condition that meets the requirements of the code.
violationsByInspectionidList.subLocation: At the Walk-in cooler & Walk-in freezer

violationsByInspectionidList.violationDescription:
(A) The FOOD-CONTACT SURFACES of cooking and baking EQUIPMENT shall be cleaned at least every 24 hours. This section does not apply to hot oil cooking and filtering EQUIPMENT if it is cleaned as specified in Subparagraph 4-602.11(D)(6).   
(B) The cavities and door seals of microwave ovens shall be cleaned at least every 24 hours by using the manufacturer's recommended cleaning procedure.
violationsByInspectionidList.itemDescription: Microwave oven door seals and cavities

violationsByInspectionidList.violationDescription:
(A)  READY-TO-EAT, POTENTIALLY HAZARDOUS FOOD (TIME/TEMPERATURE CONTROL FOR SAFETY FOOD)  prepared and held refrigerated for more than 24 hours in a FOOD ESTABLISHMENT  shall be clearly marked at the time of preparation to indicate the date or day by which the FOOD shall be consumed. (Pf)
(B)  A container of refrigerated, commercially prepared READY-TO-EAT POTENTIALLY HAZARDOUS FOOD (TIME/TEMPERATURE CONTROL FOR SAFETY FOOD)  shall be clearly marked, at the time the original container is opened in a FOOD ESTABLISHMENT, to indicate the date or day by which the FOOD shall be consumed. (Pf)

A date marking system that does not exceed 7 days, including date of preparation, or opening is to be used. (Pf)
violationsByInspectionidList.itemDescription: In house prepared ready-to-eat potentially hazardous  food(s)

violationsByInspectionidList.violationDescription: EQUIPMENT shall be maintained in a state of repair and condition that meets the requirements of the code.

(A) PHYSICAL FACILITIES shall be cleaned as often as necessary to keep them clean.
(B) Except spill cleanup, cleaning shall be done during periods when the least amount of FOOD is exposed such as after closing.
Filters or other grease extracting EQUIPMENT shall be designed to be readily removable for cleaning and replacement if not designed to be cleaned in place.
Chemical SANITIZERS and other chemical antimicrobials applied to FOOD-CONTACT SURFACES shall meet the requirements specified in this code. (P)
violationsByInspectionidList.correctionDescription: Remove and replace to be in compliance with law.

violationsByInspectionidList.violationDescription: An air gap between the water supply inlet and the flood level rim of the PLUMBING FIXTURE, EQUIPMENT, or nonFOOD EQUIPMENT shall be at least twice the diameter of the water supply inlet and may not be less than 1 inch. (P)
violationsByInspectionidList.subItem: between supply line and flood rim of plumbing fixture
violationsByInspectionidList.problemDescription: Less than twice the diameter of supply line
violationsByInspectionidList.correctionDescription: Provide air gap that is twice the diameter of the drain line and no less than 1 inch.

violationsByInspectionidList.violationDescription: FOOD EMPLOYEES shall properly wash their hands and exposed portions of their arms for at least 20 seconds and thoroughly rinsing with clean water. EMPLOYEES shall pay particular attention to the areas underneath the fingernails and between the fingers. (P)
violationsByInspectionidList.correctionDescription: Use disposable towel to turn off faucet.

violationsByInspectionidList.violationDescription: Each HANDWASHING SINK or group of 2 adjacent HANDWASHING SINKS shall be provided with a supply of hand cleaning liquid, powder, or bar soap. (Pf)
Containers of POISONOUS OR TOXIC MATERIALS and PERSONAL CARE ITEMS shall bear a legible manufacturer's label. (Pf)

(A)  READY-TO-EAT, POTENTIALLY HAZARDOUS FOOD (TIME/TEMPERATURE CONTROL FOR SAFETY FOOD)  prepared and held refrigerated for more than 24 hours in a FOOD ESTABLISHMENT  shall be clearly marked at the time of preparation to indicate the date or day by which the FOOD shall be consumed. (Pf)
(B)  A container of refrigerated, commercially prepared READY-TO-EAT POTENTIALLY HAZARDOUS FOOD (TIME/TEMPERATURE CONTROL FOR SAFETY FOOD)  shall be clearly marked, at the time the original container is opened in a FOOD ESTABLISHMENT, to indicate the date or day by which the FOOD shall be consumed. (Pf)

A date marking system that does not exceed 7 days, including date of preparation, or opening is to be used. (Pf)
violationsByInspectionidList.itemDescription: In house prepared ready-to-eat potentially hazardous  food(s)
violationsByInspectionidList.correctionDescription: Establishment shall provide a clear date marking system.

violationsByInspectionidList.violationDescription: Except for containers holding FOOD that can be readily and unmistakably recognized such as dry pasta, working containers holding FOOD or FOOD ingredients that are removed from their original packages for use in the FOOD ESTABLISHMENT, such as cooking oils, flour, herbs, potato flakes, salt, spices, and sugar shall be identified with the common name of the FOOD.
violationsByInspectionidList.subLocation: On the side panels of Bulk food containers

violationsByInspectionidList.violationDescription:
(A) An inside storage room and area and outside storage area and enclosure, and receptacles shall be of sufficient capacity to hold REFUSE, recyclables, and returnables that accumulate.   
(B) A receptacle shall be provided in each area of the FOOD ESTABLISHMENT or PREMISES where REFUSE is generated or commonly discarded, or where recyclables or returnables are placed.   
(C) If disposable towels are used at handwashing lavatories, a waste receptacle shall be located at each lavatory or group of adjacent lavatories.

A PLUMBING SYSTEM shall be:
(A) Repaired according to LAW; (P) and
(B) Maintained in good repair.
violationsByInspectionidList.subLocation: Components of the BACK FLOW PREVENTER

violationsByInspectionidList.violationDescription: A sign or poster that notifies FOOD EMPLOYEES to wash their hands shall be provided at all HANDWASHING SINKS used by FOOD EMPLOYEES and shall be clearly visible to FOOD EMPLOYEES.
A test kit or other device that accurately measures the concentration in mg/L of SANITIZING solutions shall be provided. (Pf)

(A) PHYSICAL FACILITIES shall be cleaned as often as necessary to keep them clean.
(B) Except spill cleanup, cleaning shall be done during periods when the least amount of FOOD is exposed such as after closing.

(A) PHYSICAL FACILITIES shall be cleaned as often as necessary to keep them clean.
(B) Except spill cleanup, cleaning shall be done during periods when the least amount of FOOD is exposed such as after closing.

A PLUMBING SYSTEM shall be:
(A) Repaired according to LAW; (P) and
(B) Maintained in good repair.

(A) Receptacles and waste handling units for REFUSE, recyclables, and returnables used with materials containing FOOD residue and used outside the FOOD ESTABLISHMENT shall be designed and constructed to have tight-fitting lids, doors, or covers.
(B) Receptacles and waste handling units for REFUSE and recyclables such as an on-site compactor shall be installed so that accumulation of debris and insect and rodent attraction and harborage are minimized and effective cleaning is facilitated around and, if the unit is not installed flush with the base pad, under the unit.

(A) A HANDWASHING SINK shall be maintained so that it is accessible at all times for EMPLOYEE use and used for no other purpose. (Pf)
(B)  An automatic handwashing facility shall be used in accordance with manufacturer's instructions. (Pf)
violationsByInspectionidList.correctionDescription: Remove items from handsink.  Do not store items at handsink.

violationsByInspectionidList.violationDescription: NonFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES of EQUIPMENT shall be cleaned at a frequency necessary to preclude accumulation of soil residues.
NonFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES of EQUIPMENT shall be cleaned at a frequency necessary to preclude accumulation of soil residues.

(A) The FOOD-CONTACT SURFACES of cooking and baking EQUIPMENT shall be cleaned at least every 24 hours. This section does not apply to hot oil cooking and filtering EQUIPMENT if it is cleaned as specified in Subparagraph 4-602.11(D)(6).   
(B) The cavities and door seals of microwave ovens shall be cleaned at least every 24 hours by using the manufacturer's recommended cleaning procedure.
violationsByInspectionidList.itemDescription: Microwave oven door seals and cavities
violationsByInspectionidList.subProblem: Through out the day as necessary

EQUIPMENT shall be maintained in a state of repair and condition that meets the requirements of the code.
